title: Impact Magnitude Schema
description: Standard scale for defining the scope and significance of events, influences, or changes within the narrative universe.

descriptions.description: Detailed explanations of each magnitude level (not part of the enum, provided for documentation)

trivial.description: Effects limited to a few individuals with no lasting consequences beyond immediate participants.

minor.description: Local impact affecting a small community or group with effects lasting days to weeks.

moderate.description: Regional influence affecting multiple communities with effects persisting for months.

significant.description: Large regional or small national impact with effects lasting years and potential historical documentation.

major.description: National or multi-regional impact with effects spanning decades and definite historical significance.

historic.description: Continental or global impact changing political boundaries, cultural norms, or technological paradigms with effects lasting centuries.

world_changing.description: Global transformation that fundamentally alters civilization's trajectory, creating a clear 'before and after' division in history.

era_defining.description: Marks the transition between major historical epochs, completely reshaping society, technology, or the natural world.

reality_altering.description: Changes fundamental aspects of reality itself, altering physical laws, magical systems, or the metaphysical structure of the world.

cosmic.description: Impact extends beyond a single world or dimension, affecting multiple realities or the fundamental structure of the multiverse.
